The freshman never gets into fights and avoids them, while the elderly man often ends up in fights and usually starts them.  Risk-averse individuals tend to avoid risky situations or behaviors because they prefer lower-risk options over higher-risk ones. On the other hand, someone who is more risk-seeking would be more likely to engage in risky behaviors even if it means taking chances.  In this scenario, the freshman avoids fights altogether, which suggests he's very risk-averse. He doesn't engage in risky behavior at all, so his approach seems to minimize risks. The elderly man, however, often starts fights and ends up in them frequently. This indicates that he is more likely to take risks because starting a fight is inherently a high-risk action.
